name: sunn hemp production | sunn hemp plant, harvested | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21422/documentation

This inventory dataset covers the field activity for the production of 1 kg of Sunnhemp plant (green mater) in India in 2016-17 through Sunnhemp cultivation. This process also yield seeds as byproduct which are used for green manure. The farm has a yield of 15,000 kg fresh green matter per ha for this crop cycle. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 20-40-20 kg/ha. ;Sunnhemp Research Station (CRIJAF), Pratapgarh, Uttar Predesh has been researching in this area and has optimised the cultivation of Sunnhemp for fibre production. It is cultivated mostly as a 'kharif' crop and is sown with the commencement of South-West monsoon in the month of May and June and harvested in the month of September and October. The farming dataset, covers soil preparation (fall tillage), inputs of seeds, application of mineral and organic fertilizers, spraying pesticides, irrigation water and ends with the harvesting of Sunnhemp plant.;Insects-pest and diseases do not affect Sunnhemp crop easily. They can be applied when required. Sunnhemp as a rotational crop and being a legume it has potential to meet its requirement of nitrogen by fixation of atmospheric nitrogen by bacteriods located in the nodules in the root and this is good for soil renovation. For better crop , manuring with farm yard manure or cakes is recommended. Application of fertilizers is recommended at combination of 20 kg N, 40 kg P and 20 kg K per has been optimised for best results. Usually, Sunnhemp crop can be grown in rain-fed and irrigated conditions both, but in irrigated condition, higher production can be obtained. Two irrigations favour the production of good quality fibre.;Machinery and fixed overhead are excluded from life cycle inventory for the activity, since the machineries and fixed overheads provide services over several years, and their impacts per kg of Sunnhemp plant is very low.

This activity begins from land preparation for sowing.


The activity ends at the harvesting of the mature sunnhemp plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for main crop: 5 May 2016; harvest date of main crop: 15 Aug 2016
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data on inputs to the field activites are collected directly from the farmers and farming experts. However, the emission data were not readily available for India. Hence, Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. The data has been approximated using hemp as proxy since the tool at this stage could not support non existing crops in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data has been collected through field visit and interview. Data has been obtained from a Sunnhemp Research Station in Uttar Pradesh (North India) as they have been researching for the improvement and promotion of Sunnhemp cultivation technology in India, and expressed willingness to share the data.

exchanges.description: Reference product: Sunnhemp plant, harvested

flow.name: sunn hemp plant, harvested
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of hemp is calculated to be circa 2.67E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'benzimidazole-compound', 'pendimethalin', 'pesticide, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 5.33E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'hemp' is calculated to be circa 5.33E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.07E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
